sentences.english: There is private fury with Legg in Downing Street for rewriting the rules.
sentences.chinese: 但在唐寧街，仍然有人私下對萊格修改規定憤恨不已。

sentences.english: Chu claimed he detected no sign of resentment from the developing countries.

sentences.english: Do not think I shall say a word of sting or bitterness.
sentences.chinese: 不要以爲我會對你說一個刻薄的字，說一句憤恨的話。

sentences.english: MengFei learned that for monitoring himself, Chen mare angry.

sentences.english: She found herself swirling in a sea of resentment towards her abuser.
sentences.chinese: 她發現自己將滿腔的憤恨都拋給了她的虐待者。

sentences.english: For I am jealous over you with a godly jealousy.
sentences.chinese: 我爲你們起的憤恨，原是神那樣的憤恨。

sentences.english: Watch your aggro every time he does a meteor.

sentences.english: The resentment festered in his mind.
Your grudges③, resentments④, frustrations and jealousies will finally disappear.

sentences.english: If the summer snow iciness intervene Long Lin, the inflame hates of stare him.
sentences.chinese: 夏雪冰冷的打斷龍粼的話，憤恨的瞪着他。

sentences.english: He has a haunted look, with eyes full of spiteful anger.

sentences.english: I was full of hatred and resentment for the severe criticism.

sentences.english: I can feel anger now, but I draw the line at resentment.

sentences.english: Your guidges, resentments , frustrations, and jealousies will finally disappear.

sentences.english: Andy proud to work, but full met a group of indignation customers.

definition: overwhelmed with shock, horror or amazement/dumbstruck/aghast
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
gnashing one's teeth (idiom); displaying extreme anger/fuming with rage between gritted teeth
to be shocked/to be appalled/to be terrified
